channel.title: Ushome | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - all the latest US news, showbiz, science, sport and health stories from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Fox News's Roger Ailes threatened Donald Trump with feud over Megyn Kelly flap
item.description: New version has Fox chief Roger Ailes delivering an ultimatum and warning Trump that he was running out of time to reach detente following clash with Aug. 6 debate co-moderator Megyn Kelly.
item.media:description: NEW YORK, NY - FEBRUARY 09: President of FOX News Roger Ailes attends the "Kingsman: The Secret Service" New York premiere at SVA Theater on February 9, 2015 in New York City. (Photo by Andrew Toth/FilmMagic)

item.title: Colorado governor tries to temper fears by drinking from Animas River
item.description: Governor John Hickenlooper put an iodine tablet in a bottle of Animas River water to kill bacteria before taking a gulp Tuesday.

item.title: Lisa Vanderpump says Lady Gaga was NOT drunk when she fell outside restaurant
item.description: The Real Housewives Of Beverly Hills star says the Born This Way singer just tripped over after a night of high spirits rather than high alcohol consumption.

item.title: Oregon house cat Corduroy named world's oldest at 26
item.description: An Oregon house cat has been named the world's oldest at the ripe old age of 26.

item.title: Yellowstone bear euthanized after mauling hiker to death but her cubs are saved
item.description: Park officials killed the bear Thursday after she killed and partially ate park nurse Lance Crosby (file photo)

item.title: Vogue is full of overpriced ugly clothes by designers who despise real women
item.description: SARAH VINE: Vogue, which can produce intelligent journalism, too often dances to the tune of designers, and not the other way around. It's like the lunatics have taken over the asylum.

item.title: 'It is a parent's choice': Fiorina says of vaccinations - but backs public schools on barring kids at risk for measles and mumps
item.description: She was asked about the issue at a forum this evening in Iowa by an audience member who stated a religious objection to vaccinations because they are often tested on aborted fetuses.

item.title: Parents of Kevin Ward Jr. insist Tony Stewart is responsible for his death
item.description: Kevin Ward Jr's parents, Kevin and Pamela, told ABC News they believe Stewart tried to intimidate their son by throwing dirt over him, but ended up hitting and killing their son.

item.title: Ben Carson admits he used aborted fetus tissue for medical research in the 90s
item.description: The neurosurgeon conducted research in 1992 using two fetuses aborted in the ninth and 17th week of gestation, but insists scientists would be 'foolish' not to use tissue given to them.

item.title: Universal to reimburse theaters' extra security for Straight Outta Compton's debut
item.description: The film shows the origins of rap group N.W.A. , as well as the group's seminal 1988 album, 'Straight Outta Compton.' The music biopic will be released in US theaters on Friday.

item.title: Mike Huckabee draws large crowd at Iowa State Fair after tasting a pork chop
item.description: He trails four first-time presidential candidates in the latest survey of Iowa Republicans, and is tied for fifth at seven percent with another. But he has an advantage most of his competitors don't.
item.media:description: Republican presidential candidate, former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee samples a pork chop while visiting the Iowa Port Tent at the Iowa State Fair, Thursday, Aug. 13, 2015, in Des Moines. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel)

item.title: Christian Louboutin heel breaks the Condé Nast escalator in New York
item.description: A Christian Louboutin heel got wedged into an escalator at the Condé Nast headquarters in New York. Shoe designer Nareesha McCaffrey owned up to the pricey shoe being hers.

item.title: Georgia Baptist church bans 92-year-old because she couldn't pay a TITHE
item.description: First African Baptist Church, located in Bainbridge, allegedly booted longtime member Josephine King. Her nephew has said King 'was stunned.'

item.title: Ashlee Berryman killed outside outside Braza Bar and Grill in Everett
item.description: Ashlee Berryman had just left the Braza Bar and Grill in Everett near Boston, Massachusetts, at around 1am on Thursday when she was gunned down.

item.title: Experts say that lipstick, concealer and mineral make up are OK to work up a sweat in
item.description: Australian skin experts have weighed in on just how bad it is for your skin to wear make up to the gym - and reveal foundation can block pores and cause acne.

item.title: Al Gore insiders talking about former Vice President entering the 2016 race
item.description: The Democrat who won the popular vote in 2000, but lost out to George W. Bush has not taken any steps toward entering the current race, but party insiders are said to be considering it.

item.title: Miley Cyrus says playing Hannah Montana gave her body image issues
item.description: She rose to fame in 2006 playing perky pop princess Hannah Montana on the Disney Channel.

item.title: Lewis Fogle freed after 34-years in jail for murder of teen after new DNA evidence
item.description: Lewis Fogle, 63, will be released on bond because he remains charged and could be retried by Indiana County District Attorney Patrick Dougherty in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Nicolle Wallace: I found out from the press I was fired
item.description: The former communications chief under George W. Bush has revealed she learned she lost the gig by reading it in Variety.

item.title: Venezuelan lake is hit by lightning THOUSANDS of times an hour
item.description: Where the Catatumbo River meets Lake Maracaibo, 260 storm days each year create around 28 lightning strikes hitting the lake each minute.

item.title: Bart Palosz' family sue Connecticut town and school after he shot himself
item.description: The parents of a 15-year-old high school student who killed himself in 2013 filed a wrongful death suit against the school and town government in the wealthy community of Greenwich.

item.title: I can't take any more of Sarah Ferguson blubbing about her blubber says JAN MOIR
item.description: Oh Fergie, not again! The Duchess of York was back on American television this week, flogging the cheapo juicer she claims to be responsible for her latest dramatic weight loss, writes JAN MOIR.

item.title: Men in ancient Egypt were given 8ft-long prenups
item.description: A contract, currently hanging at the Oriental Institute of the University of Chicago reveals how one woman would be given '1.2 pieces of silver and 36 bags of grain every year for the rest of her life.'

item.title: Hillary Clinton's servergate IT company accused of illegal actions
item.description: Platte River Systems, of Denver, Colorado, maintained the 'homebrew' server at the center of the mounting scandal hitting the Clinton campaign. It was sued for illegal acts, DailyMail.com reveals.

item.title: Police K-9 at PGA Championship dies after being left in sheriff's hot car
item.description: A 3-year-old police K-9 died Wednesday after the air-conditioning unit in a squad car malfunctioned at the PGA Championship in Kohler, Wisconsin.

item.title: US weather event WILL hit the West coast and it will be the biggest since records began
item.description: Dubbed the 'Godzilla El Niño' or 'Bruce Lee El Niño', the weather event looks set to bring more rain and tropical cyclones to the Pacific Southwest since records began in 1950.

item.title: SARAH RAINEY joins the Middle Eastern boy racers flying around London in supercars
item.description: Hands gripping the steering wheel, I am perched in the front seat of a garish white Mercedes so enormous it makes me feel like one of the Borrowers, writes SARAH RAINEY.

item.title: Chinese on PR offensive as central bank devalues yuan for third consecutive day
item.description: Global stockmarkets rallied as officials at the People’s Bank of China dismissed concerns that it plans to cut the yuan more aggressively - triggering a global ‘currency war’ as other countries follow suit.

item.title: Justin Combs back on the football field after P Diddy's altercation with coach
item.description: The 45-year-old rap mogul was taken into custody by campus cops on June 22 after he allegedly attacked strength and conditioning coach Sal Alosi at an athletics facility on the UCLA campus

item.title: Barack Obama unveils summer reading list covering Nazis, racism and mass extinction
item.description: Among the six tomes he's taken to Martha's Vineyard this month is The Lowland by Jhumpa Lahiri, a novel about two Indian brothers - which was on his 2013 reading list as well.

item.title: North Carolina's Marie Holmes $188million winner spends $9million to bail out fiance
item.description: Marie Holmes, 26, from Shallotte, North Carolina, who won $188million in a Powerball jackpot in February, reportedly has bailed her convict fiance out of jail twice since then to the tune of $9million.

item.title: Doctors and nurses are unable to remove rings from patients during an emergency
item.description: Staff at Sheffield's Northern General hospital said removing titanium takes specialist equipment and could mean the blood supply to the finger may be cut off for longer while staff remove the ring.

item.title: Olympic and UFC athletes slam cruel body-shamers who claim they are 'too manly'
item.description: Two Olympic athletes, one UFC fighter, one fitness instructor, and CrossFit competitor Christmas Abbott (pictured) discussed how they feel about their bodies and ways they've been made to feel bad.

item.title: Paraguan girl, 11, gives birth to stepfather's child after being raped
item.description: The child was just ten when she was allegedly raped but the Paraguayan government refused her mother's request for an abortion because strict laws only allow it if the mother's life is in danger.

item.title: Obese Texan, Caitlin Adams, who weighed 253lbs reveals how she lost 107lbs
item.description: Caitlin Adams, 26, from Texas, transformed her body, going from a size 22 jeans to a size 10. At 5'9", she now weighs a healthy 146lbs and has decided to go back to school to study nutrition.

item.title: Brooke Shields opens up her Long Island home for Better Homes and Gardens
item.description: The star opened the doors of her 1920's Long Island cottage in the September issue of Better Homes and Gardens, and shared her interior design secrets whilst admitting she likes to kick back at home
item.media:credit: Eric Piasecki for Better Homes and Gardens

item.title: Scientists discover people with autism have 'fewer ideas but are more creative'
item.description: Scientists at the University of East Anglia found when asked to provide solutions to a problem, such as uses for a paper clip, people with autism were more creative in their ideas.

item.title: Fidel Castro pictured on his 89th birthday and tells Americans he's owed millions
item.description: One day before the historic reopening of the U.S. Embassy in Cuba, former President Fidel Castro said the U.S. owes the island country 'millions of dollars' as reparations for a decades-long embargo.

item.title: Becoming rich is more about nurture than nature, Lund University study finds
item.description: A study by Lund University in Sweden has found that the wealth of an adopted child before receiving an inheritance is similar to that of their adoptive parents, rather than their biological ones.

item.title: Sesame Street moves to HBO and you won't be able to see it on PBS until NEXT summer
item.description: Sesame Workshop, the nonprofit group behind the children's television program, has struck a deal with HBO, that will bring the next five seasons of Sesame Street to HBO, starting this fall.

item.title: Connecticut's highest court BANS death penalty in the state
item.description: In a 4-3 ruling on Thursday, Connecticut Supreme Court declared that the death penalty was unconstitutional, sparing the lives of the 11 men currently on death row in the town of Somers.

item.title: Body found in Woodland Park, Colorado chimney had probably been there YEARS
item.description: A work crew tearing down a ramshackle log cabin in Woodland Park, Colorado, came upon a human corpse partially stripped of flesh - but still wearing a sweater - lodged in the chimney.
item.media:description:
**MUST LINK IN COPY** http://pikespeakcourier.net/stories/Body-in-chimney-of-cabin-linked-to-historic-Thunderhead-casino,195472
-- Longtime Pikes Peak region builder Chuck Murphy got a call Friday from a member of his construction crew demolishing an old family cabin along Rampart Range Road in Woodland Park.
?They said they found a body stuffed in the chimney,? Murphy said. ?It was a real shock. I couldn?t believe it.?
In a news release, Woodland Park Police reported the discovery of human remains at 2:30 p.m. at a construction site. Police, the Teller County Coroner and the Colorado Bureau of Investigation were working to identify the remains. No other information was released.
The 79-year-old Murphy said the corpse was a red-haired man whose limbs had become dismembered while encased in the chimney.
?I feel so sorry for the guy who was in there because it had to be a few years,? Murphy said.
item.media:credit: Rob Carrigan of the Pikes Peak Courier

item.title: Witty Millennials of New York parody page pokes fun at grumpy twenty-somethings
item.description: Inspired by Humans of New York, the Facebook page also features New Yorkers alongside quotes. But unlike the original, these stories are made up to poke fun at 20-something living in the city.

item.title: Harvard student Aran Khanna loses Facebook internship for app that shows flaws
item.description: Aran Khanna's app - called Marauder's Map in tribute to the Harry Potter books - showed that users of Facebook Messenger could pinpoint the exact locations of people they were talking to.
item.media:description:
Facebook canceled a Harvard student's internship after he created a Google Chrome plugin that highlighted serious privacy flaws in the social network's messaging service, Boston.com reports.
In May, computer science and mathematics student Aran Khanna built Marauder's Map. It was a browser plugin that made use of the fact that people who use the Facebook Messenger share their location with everyone they message with by default.
Upon installing the plugin, users could use it to precisely track the movements of anyone they were in a conversation thread with. This included users who they were not friends with on Facebook ? and it was accurate to within a meter.

item.title: Tetris reduces smoking cravings by a fifth according to Queensland University
item.description: Psychologists asked dozens of students to report whenever they felt a craving and how strong the feeling was, before reporting back again in 15 minutes. Some participants played Tetris.

item.title: Molly Bergman performs ballad slamming presidential candidate Donald Trump
item.description: Molly Bergman (pictured), from California, wrote the song - entitled Dear Mr. Trump - and posted it on her YouTube channel. She implores the candidate to drop out of the race and apologize to women.

item.title: Nasa tests Space Launch System engine that could send humans to Mars
item.description: Nasa has successfully completed the penultimate hot fire test of an RS-25 engine - one of four engines that will power the Space Launch System in 2018.

item.title: Stylish Soho apartment made famous by Devil Wears Prada goes on the market
item.description: The stylish apartment, which featured in fashionista chick flick Devil Wears Prada, is on the market with the cool price-tag of $23,000 a month in Soho, New York.

item.title: Video shows how to toast your drink in different countries around the world
item.description: A video from beer YouTube channel Let's Grab a Beer shows viewers how to properly buy, drink and toast with beer in eight different countries around the world form Europe to Asia.

item.title: Tiger Woods rues 'awful' putting after his opening round 75 at US PGA Championship
item.description: Former world No 1 Tiger Woods blamed his putting after struggling to an opening round score of 75 in the US PGA Championship on Thursday at Whistling Straits.
item.media:description: SHEBOYGAN, WI - AUGUST 13: Tiger Woods of the United States during the first round of the 2015 PGA Championship at Whistling Straits on August 13, 2015 in Sheboygan, Wisconsin. (Photo by Tom Pennington/Getty Images)

item.title: TLC sets airdate for sex abuse documentary prompted by Duggars
item.description: TLC has set an airdate for its new documentary to raise awareness about child sexual abuse. The film, 'Breaking the Silence,' will air at 10 p.m. EDT Aug. 30

item.title: NFL murderer Aaron Hernandez's house and Hummer will be sold to pay compensation
item.description: The disgraced New England Patriots tight end has been told that his house and car in North Attleborough, MA, will be sold to help settle a civil suit brought by the family of the man he killed.

item.title: PGA Tour player Billy Hurley III's father dies of self-inflicted gunshot wound
item.description: Willard Hurley, 61, the father of PGA Tour golfer Billy Hurley III who went missing for 12 days last month, has died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound, his family have said.

item.title: Kentucky clerk defies the law and turns away gay couples seeking marriage licenses
item.description: A Kentucky clerks office turned away gay couples seeking marriage licenses on Thursday, defying a federal judge's order deeply held Christian beliefs don't excuse officials issuing them.

item.title: Colombian man has curtain rings removed from his penis by firefighters
item.description: The 50-year-old was taken to Carlos Holmes Trujillo Hospital, Colombia, when the metal rings got stuck on his manhood. But the medics didn't have the right equipment to release his member.

item.title: California man fights off black bear and then drives himself to the hospital
item.description: There has been an an uptick in bear encounters, as the California drought that's sends bears into populated areas to forage for food, officials said. Above, an image of black bear in Wyoming.
item.media:description: A black bear roams near the Lamar Valley in Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, June 24, 2011. Black bear are commonly sighted near the tree line. REUTERS/Jim Urquhart (UNITED STATES) - RTR2O7OE

item.title: Armies of biting ants infest vacationers' cars parked at airport garage
item.description: The Charlotte Douglas airport in Charlotte, North Carolina has been plagued with reports of cars parked at their parking lot being infested with thousands of ants.

item.title: Hollywood producer who ‘spied on women’ is sacked from set of sci-fi film Allegiant
item.description: The PR for the film Insurgent, starring Shailene Woodley and Theo James (pictured), has confirmed voyeur Kevin Thomas Roy (not pictured) has been sacked from the film set.

item.title: Jennifer Caswell jailed for 10 years after having sex with 15-year-old student
item.description: Jennifer Caswell, 29, a former Oklahoma middle school teacher, was sentenced to 15 years, with five years suspended, after pleading guilty to second-degree rape and other related charges.

item.title: ISIS accepts rape claiming the Koran allows attacking non-Muslim women
item.description: The chilling development came as a 12-year-old rape victim in Iraq told how her attacker insisted that what he was doing was not sinful - because she practised a religion other than Islam (file picture).

item.title: Colorado baker can't use religious beliefs to defend not making gay wedding cake
item.description: Jack Philips, who owns Masterpiece Cakeshop near Denver, Colorado, had tried to claim that making gay wedding cakes violated his religious freedom, but his argument was rejected.
item.media:description: FILE - In this March 10, 2014 file photo, Masterpiece Cakeshop owner Jack Phillips decorates a cake inside his store, in Lakewood, Colo. Phillips a suburban Denver baker who wouldnít make a wedding cake for a same-sex couple cannot cite his religious beliefs in refusing them service because it would lead to discrimination, the Colorado Court of Appeals ruled Thursday, Aug. 13, 2015. (AP Photo/Brennan Linsley, File)

item.title: Pit bull with only HALF a face still wags her tail nonstop and 'loves all people'
item.description: Khalessi the two-year-old pit bull mix was found abandoned on an Orlando, Florida lawn. She was missing her nose, nostrils, and sinus cavity - making her long front teeth hang out like the tusks.

item.title: Huma Abedin STILL hasn't sworn under oath that she's turned over all her emails
item.description: Donald Trump believes Abedin may have exposed top secret information to her 'deviant' husband, the disgraced sexting former congressman Anthony Weiner.
item.media:description: FILE - In this April 29, 2015, file photo, Huma Abedin, attends the David N. Dinkins Leadership and Public Policy Forum in New York. U.S. District Judge Richard Leon has given the State Department a few months to provide The Associated Press with thousands of documents it sought in a federal lawsuit. The Aug. 7, order means the documents, including schedules and calendars from former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton will be released months ahead of the spring presidential primary elections. Leon ordered the department to produce within 30 days records related to Abedin, a former top Clinton aide, during her time as secretary of state. (AP Photo/Mark Lennihan, File)

item.title: Samsung launches Galaxy S6 edge+ phablet
item.description: Samsung unveiled its larger Galaxy S6 Edge+ handset in London, which bears some resemblance to the iPhone 6 Plus, as well as another phablet - the Note 5.

item.title: Partridge Family's Suzanne Crough died at age 52 of a rare heart condition
item.description: Crough, best known for her role as the Tracy Partridge on the hit 1970s sitcom, succumbed to arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia - a heart condition that affect 1 in 5,000 people.

item.title: Clemson fraternity pledge Tucker Hipps died walking along a bridge safety railing
item.description: Tucker Hipps, 19, died last year after plunging 20ft from a bridge in Clemson, South Carolina, and now a new witness says the sophomore fell after being forced to walk along the top of a safety railing.

item.title: Hospitals braced for baby boom in upstate New York - nine months after snow storm
item.description: Buffalo, New York, was the hardest hit by the so-called November Storm a week before Thanksgiving that saw seven feet of snow settle. This month local hospitals expect a 25 per cent spike in birth rates.

item.title: Connecticut police seek missing Jeffrey and Jeanette Navin who vanished a week ago
item.description: Jeanette Navin, 55, a sanitation company owner, and his librarian wife, Jeanette 55, were reported missing August 7 by family members who told police they have not been seen since August 4.

item.title: Charlie Hill who murdered a cop and hijacked a plane to Cuba fears US extradition
item.description: In 1971, Charlie Hill was accused of killing a cop and hijacking a plane to Cuba, where he has been living ever since.

item.title: CNN reporter is attacked by families of victims injured in China's Tijuan warehouse explosions
item.description: Standing outside the main hospital in decimated China port city of Tijuan, CNN reporter Will Ripley had just started speaking to the camera when the mob began to form around him.

item.title: Genetic test proves President Harding DID have a love child with mistress
item.description: Relatives of Warren G Harding revealed on Wednesday that he did indeed father a daughter in 1919 with his longtime mistress Nan Britton.

item.title: Hillary Clinton's emails contained secret CIA intelligence and satellite info
item.description: As Clinton splits hairs over when the top-secret information was classified, Republicans on Capitol Hill complain her spin 'doesn't pass the smell test.'

item.title: New Black Panther activists threaten Texas police while protesting Sandra Bland's death
item.description: Armed with AR-15 assault rifles, shotguns and hunting rifles, the activists shouted death threats to police while leading a two-hour march to Waller County Jail in Texas.

item.title: Life lessons EVERY parent should teach their children revealed
item.description: A new poll of things every parent should teach their children reveals that respecting your elders was voted second (75 percent) while having good table manners came third (73 percent).
item.media:description:
A mother reading a bedtime story book to her child.
Bedtime story Book Child Mother Reading book Teddy
B4WNBN

item.title: Tattoo artist Megan Massacre rose above fierce criticism from women
item.description: American tattoo queen Megan Massacre is currently starring in MTV's Bondi Ink. She revealed that while she is now adored across the world, she faced harsh criticism early on in her career.

item.title: Human Brain Mapping brain scans reveal strong couples share each other's joy
item.description: Researchers in Canada found happily married women were more sensitive to their husband’s unexpected positive emotions than to their negative ones.

item.title: Immigrant population in US hits 42M amid surge in Mexicans crossing the border
item.description: In the past year alone, 1.7million legal and illegal immigrants have entered the United States, a new analysis of Census Bureau data shows. Of these, 740,000 - more than 43 per cent - are Mexicans.

item.title: Johannesburg police officer couple shoot intruders trying to smash into home
item.description: The raiders forced open the gate leading to the house in Kibler Park, Johannesburg, South Africa, before kicking the door open and threatening the couple inside with guns.

item.title: Conspiracy theories are so 'romanticised' that believers are willing to ignore factual errors
item.description: Researchers from Winchester University asked 802 American participants to read what they called a ‘short mock news article about a fictitious political scandal in Canada’.

item.title: Pakistan sentences to death six Islamists for Peshawar school attack
item.description: Pakistani military courts have sentenced seven Islamic militants to death over a series of attacks, including an assault on a school that killed more than 150 people in Peshawar last December

item.title: Low-carb diets 'are best for weight loss but forsaking fat is BETTER'
item.description: Scientists from the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney diseases, pitted a low-carb diet against a low-fat one and concluded cutting out fat is better for overall health.

item.title: Brunswick, Maryland man killed his wife in murder suicide on the day of divorce
item.description: Police are investigating the deaths of a woman and her estranged husband in what is thought to be a case of murder-suicide. Kelly Shortt-Hamilton was due to sign divorce papers with Daniel Shortt in Brunswick.

item.title: Emirates announces world's longest non-stop flight from Dubai to Panama City
item.description: The airline hopes that connecting the Middle East with Panama's largest city will open up Central America, South America and beyond.

item.title: Staten Island sisters give birth just 30 minutes apart in adjoining hospital rooms
item.description: Sisters Alexis Arfe, 23, and Jessica Slomnicki, 28, gave birth on Tuesday just half an hour apart in adjoining rooms at State Island University Hospital.

item.title: Worried Cuba will become Americanised? Here's evidence it already is
item.description: Cuba is a country whose language, music, literature and fashion are steeped in American influence despite the ban on tourists. Relations are set to thaw, especially with the opening of a US embassy.

item.title: Florida dad arrested for 'taking daughter, 16, to Pink Pony strip club, giving her cocaine
item.description: Jose Manuel Arguelles, 59, a divorced club promoter from Doral, has been charged with child neglect, giving drugs to child and eight counts of sexual performance by a child.

item.title: WGN-TV viewers' amusement after news crews show weather map resembling a giant penis
item.description: The map, created by AccuWeather.com and broadcast by TV news crews on Tuesday morning, features a green band of rain and storms that bears an unfortunate resemblance to a penis.

item.title: Chinese miners unearth 100m year-old marbled stones that looks like PORK LOINS
item.description: Stunned iron ore miners in northwest China were flabbergasted when they accidentally dug up several spectacular 100 million year-old Jurassic stones that resemble pork loins this week.

item.title: Man pretends to be Forrest Gump in Tinder meesages exchange
item.description: Blake, 24, listed his hobbies on the dating app to mirror those of Tom Hanks' character in the 1994 blockbuster Forrest Gump - and comically one woman failed to spot the connection.

item.title: Ex New Jersey mayor Matthew Scannapieco pleads guilty to raping child aged 6
item.description: Former Marlboro mayor Matthew V. Scannapieco, 71, a Republican, admitted to detectives that he had sexual contact with a female child relative 50 to 60 times between 2006 and 2008.

item.title: Al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri pledges allegiance to the Taliban's new chief
item.description: In a new audio recording, Zawahiri paid tribute to the late Taliban chief Mullah Omar, whose death from tuberculosis was confirmed by Afghan-based jihadis last month.

item.title: Ohio's Bible Walk Museum uses old waxworks of famous people
item.description: The famous wax models have been acquired by the Bible Walk museum in Mansfield in Ohio, ever since it was founded in August 1983. The models were rescued from closing museums.

item.title: Treasure trove of warrior jewellery unearthed in Russia: Ancient grave belongs to woman who worshipped fire 2,000 years ago
item.description: The female fighter was a Sarmatian, a people who worshipped fire and whose prominent role in warfare was seen as an inspiration for the Amazons of Greek mythology.

item.title: Carrier pigeon caught carrying cocaine into Costa Rican prison
item.description: Officers at La Reforma prison captured the pigeon (pictured) with 14g of cocaine and 14g of cannabis stuffed into a black pouch which camouflaged against its dark feathers.

item.title: Uniqlo sword attack in Beijing leaves woman stabbed to death
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT A man armed with a metre-long sword has stabbed a woman to death in Beijing's busy Sanlitun district. Attacker also slashed a French man in the random attack.

item.title: Transgender teen Jazz Jennings reveals the hurtful comments from online trolls
item.description: On the latest episode of the TLC reality show I am Jazz, the 14-year-old star reads comments left on her YouTube videos calling her 'it' instead of 'she' and claiming the devil is tricking her.

item.title: Disgruntled man can't pay parking fine with rolls of pennies
item.description: A Pennsylvania handyman slapped with a parking fine tried to enact his revenge on the local council by paying his $25 fine with with 2,500 pennies. The aim was to cause inconvenience to staff.

item.title: Intelligence and longevity 'is down to good genes' as smart people live longer
item.description: Scientists at the London School of Economics found by analysing twins that 95 per cent of the link between intelligence and lifespan is down to a person's genetics, not the choices they make in life.

item.title: Gidget is the world's smallest caravan that is fully-equipped at just eight-feet long
item.description: The Tardis-like creation, the brainchild of two Australians, has been taking campsites by storm this summer because it's so small that it can be easily towed like a trailer.

item.title: Italian woman who was made to give up a baby she had with a Nazi soldier is reunited with her long lost daughter after 71 years
item.description: She was just 20-years-old when she was forced to hand over her baby to the Nazi authorities but now an Italian grandmother has been reunited with her daughter for the first time in 71 years.

item.title: Russian waterway on fire with with column of black smoke after oil pipe ruptures
item.description: A ball of fire and a huge black cloud of smoke engulfed Moscow River after a suspected rupture to an underwater oil pipeline caught light.

item.title: Brody Curtis with skin condition epidermolysis bullos left in constant pain
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Brody Curtis, four, of Charlestown, Indiana, suffers from epidermolysis bullosa. His body is covered with painful, blistering wounds that will never heal.
